voicesplitting.voice

Class VoiceSplittingModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.generic.MidiModelState
      • voicesplitting.voice.VoiceSplittingModelState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HmmVoiceSplittingModelState

    public abstract class VoiceSplittingModelState
extends MidiModelState
    A VoiceSplittingModelState is an abstract MidiModelState which splits incoming MidiNotes into Voices. In order to get these voices, the getVoices() method should be called.

    Note that the handleIncoming(List) method here now returns TreeSet rather than TreeSet as in MidiModelState.handleIncoming(List).

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 4 Sept, 2015

    • Method Detail

      • getVoices

        public abstract java.util.List<Voice> getVoices()
        Gets the Voices which are currently contained by this state.
        Returns:
        A List of the Voices contained by this State.

      • handleIncoming

        public abstract java.util.TreeSet<? extends VoiceSplittingModelState> handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        Return a TreeSet of all of the possible VoiceSplittingModelStates which we could tansition into given the List of MidiNotes.

        NOTE: It is assumed that the notes Lists passed into this method will be passed chronologically. Specifically, each time this method is invoked, it should be passed the List of MidiNotes which occur next in the MIDI song currently being read.

        Usually, this method is simply called by some VoiceSplittingModel's MidiModel.handleIncoming(List) method.

        Specified by:
        handleIncoming in class MidiModelState
        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes on which we need to transition.
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of VoiceSplittingModelStates which we've transitioned into. The new VoiceSplittingModelStates should not hold any common mutable objects, since they may modify them in the future.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the String representation of this object, which is simply the List of Voices returned by getVoices().
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The String representation of this object.
